The rise of quantum computing presents a serious threat to Web3 security, making it essential to build strong foundations of digital trust and cybersecurity.

Naoris Protocol (@NaorisProtocol) offers a solution built for this future.

What is Naoris Protocol?

Naoris Protocol is the world‚Äôs first Decentralized Post-Quantum Infrastructure, operating at the Sub-Zero Layer‚Äîa trust and security layer beneath Layer 0 to Layer 3 blockchains.

üîë Key Features:

‚û°Ô∏è Fully compatible with EVM blockchains; no hard forks required. It also secures all types of infrastructure, like

- Web3: nodes, validators, bridges, DEXs, and dApps

- Web2: enterprise systems, platforms, and IoT devices

‚û°Ô∏è Combines cutting-edge technologies to combat both traditional and quantum
threats:

üëâ Post-Quantum Cryptography
üëâ dPoSec (Decentralized
üëâ Proof-of-Security) Consensus
üëâ Decentralized Swarm AI

What Makes Naoris Protocol Stand Out?
 
‚úÖ Quantum-Secure Transactions:
Shields current EVM chains from quantum attacks‚Äîwithout any network disruption.

‚úÖ Trusted Web3 Infrastructure:
Real-time, immutable mesh protects critical Web3 components like nodes, bridges, and DEXs.
 
‚úÖ Resilient Web2 Protection:
Every device becomes a cyber-trusted validator, forming a self-healing, scalable mesh with no single point of failure.
 
Numbers speak of rapid growth since the testnet launch (January):

üëâ 100M+ post-quantum transactions processed
üëâ 3.3M wallets onboarded
üëâ 1M+ security nodes deployed
üëâ 452M+ cyber threats neutralized
 
The $NAORIS token powers a decentralized, quantum-resistant
infrastructure designed to secure the next generation of the internet.

Disclaimer - we have invested in Naoris protocol so please don‚Äôt forget to do your own research.

Daily Market Brief:
northmantrader.com/2025/07/3‚Ä¶
The presidential detente with the Fed chair lasted all of one week
This chart can also substitute as a chart of Trump's blood pressure.

If Fed dissents lead the way, then today's 2 dissents mean the Fed will eventually cut rates.

However, the June dots indicate that 7 on the FOMC are opposed to 2025 rate cuts (red box). 

If this is now a new era of dissent, then a September rate cut should see dissents AGAINST it.

Meta and Microsoft reported right after the closing bell. They blew away estimates, and both of their stocks are flying higher.

The red box is what Powell did to the S&P 500 (no rate cut in September)

The green box is what Meta and Microsoft are doing to it after hours.
---
*MICROSOFT 4Q REV. $76.44B, EST. $73.89B
*MICROSOFT 4Q AZURE & OTHER CLOUD REV EX-FX +39%, EST. +34.2%
*MICROSOFT SHARES JUMP 7% AFTER 4Q REVENUE BEATS ESTIMATE
*META SEES 3Q REV. $47.5B TO $50.5B, EST. $46.2B
*META SHARES JUMP 6.8% AFTER 3Q REVENUE OUTLOOK BEATS ESTIMATE

A tick chart of the probability of a rate cut at the September meeting. The red box is where Powell was speaking.

It started at -66% for a cut (minus = cut, positive = hike), and it is currently at -45%, meaning there is a greater probability that the Fed will hold rates the same in September than cut them.

Who wants to tell Trump?

Marnier Eccles stopped being Fed Chairman in 1948 and stayed in as a Fed Governor until 1951.

Jay Powell's term as a Governor runs through 2029.

*POWELL: NO UPDATE ON IF I WILL STAY ON AS GOVERNOR POST-CHAIR

Powell just told us what his priority is.

*POWELL: INFLATION IS FURTHER FROM OUR GOAL THAN EMPLOYMENT

*POWELL: TOTALITY OF DATA SHOW YOU'VE GOT A SOLID LABOR MARKET

@FerroTV @lisaabramowicz1 @tomkeene

Powell is killing the odds of a September rate cut.
Now under 50%.

I will be on @BloombergTV  from 2:00 p.m. ET to 2:30 p.m. ET, reacting to the Fed meeting.

I will be on with @DianeSwonk.

Economists who translate the CPI and PPI into the PCE expect monthly core inflation firmed in June. BEA reports this on Thursday.

Core PCE estimate: +0.29% (highest since February), which would push the year-over-year to 2.8%

Headline PCE: +0.32% (y/y rises to 2.5%)

For our premium members last week, we covered one stock at the heart of AI, its accelerating AI growth and increased annual forecast.

io-fund.com/premium-services‚Ä¶

Microsoft $MSFT disclosed that Azure revenue grew 34% YoY to surpass $75 billion in fiscal 2025.

$AMZN $GOOG

Arm $ARM is working to develop its own chips, a major shift away from its licensing-based model, though it did not provide a timeline for products, saying it could involve chiplets, physical chips, boards, a system, or all of the above.

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO

Microsoft $MSFT guided for 37% growth in constant currency for Azure next quarter, though it noted it is still capacity constrained.

Microsoft also outlined $30 billion in capex, up from $24.2 billion this quarter.

$AMZN $GOOG $NVDA $AMD

Meta $META reported 22% revenue growth to $47.5B, while EPS rose 38% to $7.14, well ahead of estimates for $44.84B and $5.86.

Meta also narrowed its capex guide from $64-72B to $66-72B for the year.

$MSFT $GOOG $AMZN $NVDA

Microsoft $MSFT reported $76.4 billion in revenue in Q4, up 18%, while EPS rose 24% to $3.65.

Azure grew 39% in the quarter, well ahead of guidance for 34-35%. 

$GOOG $AMZN $META

Arm $ARM reported $1.05 billion in revenue in Q1, slightly below estimates, with royalty revenue rising 25% YoY to $585 million. Adjusted EPS was in line at $0.35.

For Q2, Arm guided $1.01-1.11B, slightly short of estimates for $1.07B at midpoint, with EPS of $0.29-0.37, below the $0.35 estimate. 

$NVDA $QCOM $AMD

Qualcomm $QCOM reported $10.37B in revenue with EPS of $2.77, slightly ahead of estimates.

Q4 was guided slightly above as well, with revenue guided to $10.3-11.1B vs the $10.61B estimate, and EPS of $2.75-2.95 vs the $2.82 estimate. 

$ARM $NVDA $AMD $INTC

Qualcomm $QCOM is expected to report 10.2% revenue growth to $10.35B in its fiscal Q3, with EPS rising 16.5% to $2.71.

$ARM $NVDA $AMD $INTC

Arm $ARM is expected to report 13% revenue growth to $1.06 billion in its fiscal Q1, slightly above the midpoint of its $1.0-1.1 billion guide. 

Adjusted EPS is expected to be $0.35, down (12.5%) YoY. 

$QCOM $NVDA $AMD

Microsoft $MSFT is expected to report $73.8 billion in revenue in fiscal Q4, up 14% YoY, with EPS rising 15% to $3.38.

Analysts are expecting Azure to grow 34.4% on strong AI demand.

$GOOG $AMZN $META $NVDA

Meta $META is expected to report 14.8% revenue growth to $44.84 billion in Q2, with EPS rising 13.5% to $5.86. 

Capex will be in focus after Meta's recent commitment to investing "hundreds of billions of dollars" in a quest to reach superintelligence.

$MSFT $GOOG $AMZN

Alibaba $BABA last week launched its open-source advanced AI coding model Qwen3-Coder, which is touted as its most advanced AI model to date. 

$MSFT $META $GOOG $AMZN

Crusoe and Tallgrass partnered to build a 1.8GW data center campus in Wyoming, with the possibility of scaling up to 10GW. 

Construction is expected to begin soon.

$AMD $MSFT $META $GOOG $NVDA

Vertiv $VRT also hiked its FY25 revenue outlook once again, now seeing $9.925-10.075B in revenue, up from $9.325-9.575B last quarter. 

$NVDA

Vertiv $VRT reported 35.4% growth to $2.64B in revenue in Q2, while adjusted EPS also beat at $0.95.

For Q3, Vertiv guided for revenue between $2.51-2.59B, with adjusted EPS of $0.94-1.00, versus estimates for $2.43B and $0.96.

The distribution rate = Latest distribution annualized / current NAV

The 30-day SEC yield is a standardized measure of the income earned by a fund, typically a bond fund or ETF, over a 30-day period, annualized to provide an estimated annual return.

* The Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield is not indicative of future distributions, if any, on the ETFs. In particular, future distributions on any ETF may differ significantly from its Distribution Rate or 30-Day SEC Yield. You are not guaranteed a distribution under the ETFs. Distributions for the ETFs (if any) are variable and may vary significantly from month to month and may be zero. Accordingly, the Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield will change over time, and such change may be significant. The distribution may include a combination of ordinary dividends, capital gain, and return of investor capital, which may decrease a fund‚Äôs NAV and trading price over time. As a result, an investor may suffer significant losses to their investment. These distribution rates caused by unusually favorable market conditions may not be sustainable. Such conditions may not continue to exist and there should be no expectation that this performance may be repeated in the future. Stated distribution frequency subject to change. Additional fund risks can be found below.
